segments.text: Hello miss . Can I see your ticket number ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure , here you are . And here are my application forms as well .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Thank you miss ... Wang . I'm Bob Jones and I'll be handling your application .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Nice to meet you Mr . Jones .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The first step is to determine your eligibility for a U . S . visa . Let's see here ... you're applying for a special business visa . Why is that ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , my first order of business will be attending a conference in Seattle , but after that I intend to spend two weeks visiting my friends . I assumed a business visa would be required .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think a regular visitor's visa should suffice . With this visa , you can stay in the United States for up to 90 days .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: So I can attend conferences and do business on that visa ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . You are free to do temporary business with this visa . If you were planning on setting up a new business in the U . S . you might need to apply for a long-term visa .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , I see . I think 90 days is more than enough time .
segments.speaker: S2
